Author: jl777c#5810
Content: as long as the RNG of rogue can be used, then there is no problem. everytime you get a random number, the next one is calculated. there is no need to go back to high entropy source for each random number

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: 1000 rogue games will take a second or two to replay, tetris I imagine will be faster

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: at worst we would need to make longer blocktimes

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: let us not overengineer things. zksnarks? math that is very hard to understand, fancy other things... not the best thing to start with such complex things

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: I always start with the simplest possible solution

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: often it is good enough and then I am done

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: if not, then I step it up to the next level of complexity and I stop as soon as the problem is solved. this ends up with arguably the simplest solution that solves the problem

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: sure, it is good to have bazooka, emp, hellfire missles in your toolkit, but if a flyswatter is all that is needed, just use that

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: the only issue about tetris that is different than rogue (other than tetris is MUCH simpler gameplay) is that not doing anything creates an event. that is the only real difference, so I dont expect there to be much different in the solution. maybe just just run length encoding of keystrokes

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: do not overengineer things, especially blockchain logic

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: it has to be dead simple, else it wont ever consensus

Author: Alright#0419
Content: will every rogue node validate every game? same seed, same inputs, same result?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: "will" ?? they have been since early blocks

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: it is the blockchain consensus concept applied to rogue

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: terribly inefficient, but impossible to cheat

Author: Alright#0419
Content: Does a tetris game in this situation need randomness every 7 in-game blocks or just a single seed of entropy to start a game?

Author: Alright#0419
Content: I keep explaining this concept to joker(same seed, same input, same outcome), and he is convinced it's impractical to code game logic into consensus for every single node

Author: Mylo#8306
Content:
game logic is logic.
crypto condition logic is logic.
wallet logic is logic.
it is all logic.   the faucet logic goes around in a loop until a transaction ends in 00 to stop leechers.
game logic is just to replay.  not in realtime.  super fast.

Author: Mylo#8306
Content: tetris.  who knows.  maybe the game was written in a time when computing 50k random numbers was expensive for cpu & ram.

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: forgery of playerdata is doublespending

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: delaying of dying is reorging

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: you can delay your death, but you cant create a win, unless you actually win

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: you can reorg the keystrokes

Author: jl777c#5810

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: bailing out is a valid set of keystrokes and you didnt create gold out of nothing, you had the gold

Author: Alright#0419
Content: so maybe death shouldn't give you 0 gold?

Author: Mylo#8306
Content: take a ticket from a queue, the ticket and the keystroke are now bound.  next ticket from queue next keystroke bound to it.  throw them all  together in a ticket/receipt style hash.   hard to undo...surely
